benchmark_details.name: VIDHALLUC
benchmark_details.overview: The largest benchmark designed to examine hallucinations in multimodal large language models (MLLMs) for video understanding tasks. It evaluates hallucinations across three dimensions: action, temporal sequence, and scene transition.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and understand hallucinations in multimodal large language models for video understanding tasks.

data.source: Curated from existing video description datasets including ActivityNet, YouCook2, and VALOR32K.
data.annotation: Dynamic video pairs with automated question generation targeting hallucination types.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated using Ncorrect/Ntotal where Ncorrect is the number of correctly answered questions and Ntotal is the total questions asked.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance against hallucinations for MLLMs across the tasks defined.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted with ten state-of-the-art models including performance comparisons.

risk_categories: Inability to differentiate between visually similar video pairs
